question: A person walking barefooted in a field feels a sharp sting and on examination two puncture marks are found on his leg. He is most probably bitten by which of the following ages?
explanation: Snakebite is an injury caused by the bite of a snake, especially a venomous snake. A common sign of a bite from a venomous snake is the presence of two puncture wounds from the animal\'s fangs. Those bitten may also describe a “sharp”, \"rubbery\", \"minty\", or \"metallic\" taste if bitten.
